sounds like someone's having themselves a shootout.
but not a single passerby pays any attention to it.
firefights and bloodshed are everyday occurrences here in amidahara.
you can't survive in this town if you let every little thing bother you.
the cops aren't even coming with sirens blaring.
their authority and handle on violence extends only to the periphery of amidahara -- the border with the outside world.
if you've got trouble, you're on your own.
if it doesn't concern you, then leave it alone.
that's what passes for common sense here.
since getting taken in six months ago by annerose, i've gotten a little more used to it.
that excludes getting attacked myself, of course.

name: rikurou
normalized: …does that mean anything?
i often visit that supermarket myself, but they've got illegal drugs and stuff sitting right out in the open in the pharmacy section…
or in the grocery section, they've got weird "things" right next to the run-of-the-mill foodstuffs on the shelf that clearly aren't of this world.
the cashier blowing away some shoplifter while i'm busypicking out stuff for dinner has become a familiar scene.
it's that kind of supermarket that had warehouse trouble.
er, wait a minute.

name: rikurou
normalized: annerose.

normalized: what?

name: rikurou
normalized: isn't that place under protection of the 'jimmu group?

name: annerose
normalized: yeah.
annerose readily nods.
hey, aren't we forgetting something here?
what it means to attack an organization's turf?
amidahara is largely broken up between three major powers.
the jimmu group is the first of these, a mafia comprised of several yakuza gangs.
a yakuza federation, so to speak.
they're kind of pigeonholed into hostilities with anything from the "outside" in demon city amidahara.
against them is the kowloon clan, comprised of chinese all over the globe and their underworld.
they have strong ties with their homeland, the chinese union, and their war with the jimmu group for turf and control over amidahara's "myriad vices" knows no end.
and finally, left behind in amidahara from the old peninsular conflict, an irregular unit gone rogue from the uac, nicknamed the black dogs.
they're staying out of jimmu group and kowloon clan affairs, but maintain cyborg soldiers as avatars of the uac's "science is god" doctrine.
they're bad news.

name: annerose
normalized: hmhm… so they put on the innocent front while selling the stolen goods on the black market, then hire me to make sure there aren't any 'inconsistencies,' huh?

name: rikurou
normalized: that's certainly a possibility…"
i look at her with a nod.
the shiny look in her eyes says she's thinking of how to twist their arm on that to score a little extra.

name: rikurou
normalized: the magic temple.
some tourist lost their pet and they want us to go look for it.

name: annerose
normalized: from grandma?
still softhearted as ever, she should've just left those dumb tourists alone.
despite saying so, annerose's face is filled with tender emotion.
the magic temple is amidahara's one and only souvenir shop.
that's right, a souvenir shop.
with stuff like local cookies, pastries, keychains, charms, ornaments, tapestries -- the usual fare of any sightseeing destination.
a kind little old lady named neu runs the place, and it's apparently popular with tourists in its own right.
which means you can waltz right in from the "outside" and still be okay as long as you don't wander off too far.
annerose must go way back with neu since she calls her "grandma" and holds her very close.
she occasionally stops by to enjoy my coffee, and is an irreplaceable person in this town who brings calm to people's souls.
since neu's such a softie, it's simply impossible for her to turn down a request from some dumb tourist that drags their pet out here and then has it go missing.

name: annerose
normalized: well, if it's from grandma that's all there is to it.

name: annerose
normalized: …tch.
annerose clicks her tongue.
i thought it was because of the stupid maid and i going at it again, but that wasn't it.
actually, i wish it had been.
because… "she" came strolling over.
annerose's sworn enemy.
mayfeng lee.
a beautiful woman in a high-cut china dress.
her slender limbs, insane body and sense of style are right on par with annerose.
on top of that, her dress has high, wide slits on either side -- more accurately, it's just hanging down the front and back.
another slit from her navel to her chest has her cleavage on full display, and i can't tell from here, but the back is probably wide open, too.
her sex appeal is crazy.
from a man's perspective she's mind-numbingly hot from all angles, but the scary look in her eyes doesn't match the rest of the pretty picture.
her thin, sharp eyes are as cold as ice and filled with sadistic light, lacking any of annerose's good humor.
she exudes an air that says she'd kill a man she didn't like on the spot if he accidentally looked where he shouldn't.
and that's no exaggeration either.
mayfeng lee is an assassin working for the kowloon clan.
she uses weapons called rope darts, small blades attached to rope, skillfully wielding them like living things.
on top of that, she's also a specialist capable of usingdreadful hexing magic.
her trade name is white snake.
rumor has it she actually keeps a serpent from the demon world inside her body.
everyone in amidahara knows of her.
myself included.
and there's one other minor detail.
she and the steel witch annerose get along like cats and dogs.
it doesn't sound like they've butted heads on jobs just once or twice.
nor had as few deathmatches, either.
the only reason things haven't been settled yet between these two fearsome beauties is that they're both evenly matched.
so in short, sworn enemies.
by the time i groaned, it was already too late.
mayfeng is headed straight this way with her entourage of kowloon clan lackeys.
she's locked on, staring daggers at annerose.
annerose exudes displeasure from every pore in her body and strides out to meet her.
they're on a crash course with each other.
unfortunately, it seems these two can't let the other pass on by.
with sparks flying between them, they stop just short enough to grab the other's collar.
